reviews.review_msg: The concepts were tough, and he wasn't the best at explaining . Lecture slides were formatted poorly and showed up all scrambled up when you tried to download them. Be ready to do a quiz like every class, plus 2 mid terms and a final. The course was way too test heavy. if you do bad on quizzes or exams,  nothing else brings your grade up.

Amateur lecture presentations looked like it was done be a kid in high school. Grading for exams was all over the place no consistency. Doesn't seem like he cares about teaching or wants to see his students succeed. Doesn't offer help outside of office hours. If you take this class get ready to learn everything on your own

Honestly not as bad as I expected it to be. Be ready for pop quizes. But not very difficult if you keep up with class materials. I would reccomend attend every class and especially pay attention to in class examples/ questions. He does tend to ramble but explains the questions well. If you don't understand, there's always AI.

Not a good speaker. I don't know why he is teaching, I sense no passion. More like just a job for him. I learned by looking at worked out solutions, not by listening from him. I'm nearly done my degree and have had my fair share of good and bad profs. This prof is in my bad profs list in terms of quality and attitude. Worst of all is the attitude.

Steve regularly questions the capability of his students and takes no responsibility for his student's failures. He is blunt, rude, and unaccomodating, overcomplicating his lecture material to the point where self-teaching is necessary. Truly unfortunate that Business Minor students are stuck with only one professor for this course.

The semester is almost over and I can honestly say Steve is a nice guy. I failed the first two midterms and was pretty salty towards him and the class too, till I started going to his office hours, reading his handouts clearly and really paying attention in class. He's honestly so funny too. Work hard = you'll do well

Good luck. This professor can't even explain certain key concepts properly, yet tells us to not follow the textbook at certain points because its 'too difficult'. The way the quizzes, assignments, and exams are set up are not to learn, but simply to derail you. IF on the offchance there's another prof, take anyone but him. Moneymaker for SFU.

Steve is a one of the best professors at SFU. His class is always fun and he uses lots of humour which makes even the boring lectures fun. Make sure you keep up with the lectures by self-study and you'll be fine. Honestly, the course itself is not tough. It just needs a bit of practice and Steve's amazing knowledge.

The course covers a lot of ground and it builds on previous courses. Hate the material but cannot fault the professor. He provided lots of videos and extra practice quizzes. Not a good class to take if you dont want to work. But it is required for Bus minor and it is a 4 credit class.

Does two chapters a week and two quizzes a week. He expects his students to already be affluent in the material. His class examples tell you the answer, and while he explains the conceptual reasoning for them, he does not show you the steps to calculate. Hence why there are low averages for quizzes and tests. If you can, choose a diff prof
very negative teacher... beware of surprise quizzes first thing early in the morning...
Tough grader. Does not sympathize with students.

We had 100 mins to do the midterm with 50 questions. Extra 4 marks were added to the midterm because he said we didn't have enough time to do it. However, we only had 90 mins for the final with 58 questions, it involved lots of calculations. The short time limit for quizzes and exams almost drove me crazy. Don't understand what he's thinking.

If you can avoid this man, do so. His lectures are messy. The best example I could think of you make you reconsider is that he didn't use Excel to show how to do a balance sheet. EXCEL, in an accounting class... Who would have thought.

The sem's nearly over & in all honesty, Steve's been a really great prof. He does a lot of in class examples, is pretty lenient w/ marking & he's just super personable. He's quite sarcastic, but like, hey, accounting/finance is zzzz, so any opp for some lols I'm down! Given COVID-19 rn, he's doing the most to get the material thru to us. Thanks!

Basically paying to watch him do calculations. He sprints through lecture material as if you should already know what he's talking about and only engages with like two people who are really smart. He gives open book quizzes every week that you do with a partner (however it doesnt help because both of you are probably confused anyway). Worst prof!

Really enjoyed Steve's lectures. If you keep up with the lectures and homework, you can cruise through the class. Uses good analogies. Parts of lecture are sometimes used for quizzes which often just replace/copy homework questions, which is easy. For what the material is (arithmetic and intuition), his lectures are pretty engaging.
Only looks towards the board and solves questions. Does not engage the class AT ALL!
